title: Vocational High School Social and Job Competency Enhancement Program via Augmented Reality-Based Mobile Learning: Integrating Citizenship and Economic Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic vocational education concepts, digital device proficiency, foundational knowledge of socio-economic structures (market economy principles, social mobility, citizen rights, etc.)
context.additional_context: Short-term intensive course strengthening vocational education competencies through hands-on augmented reality (AR) content and mobile learning tools. Operates a formative assessment-centered feedback system, comprehensively evaluating learners' civic competencies (social participation, rights awareness) and job adaptability (industry understanding, problem-solving). Emphasizes project-based learning for solving local community issues.

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to solve socio-economic issues in vocational fields (e.g., regional economic imbalance, labor rights) using Augmented Reality-based Mobile Learning (ARMOL).

In AR-based simulation environments (e.g., Minecraft Education Edition), learners can complete two 3-person team projects while fulfilling â‰¥4 of 5 communication checklists (goal setting, resource allocation, conflict management, decision-making participation, result sharing).
Develop creative thinking and critical analysis skills regarding vocational environments (e.g., labor market trends, corporate-social relations) through mobile learning tools.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
